image.altText: A person scrapes bees from a board with a comb.

props.synopsis: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

title.children: Half of Canberra's beehives could be wiped out in two years. Here's why

props.synopsis: As Australia and England clash in The Ashes cricket series, Australian War Memorial historians have uncovered two diaries that recount a cricket series played behind barbed wire in prisoner of war camps.

title.children: Cricket cartoons and a 'substitute' Ashes in AWM collection

image.altText: A young man leaves court.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old Canberra man accused of performing Nazi salutes in public and spreading extremist propaganda has been released on strict bail conditions after spending Christmas Day in custody.

title.children: Teenager accused of Nazi salutes granted bail in ACT court

image.altText: Reading 5

props.synopsis: There are books from authors that would become household names — F. Scott Fitzgerald and A.A Milne among them — and books that are now banned in some countries. But what can we learn from what people were reading in 1925?

title.children: What a 1925 summer reading list reveals about us

image.altText: Papyrus

props.synopsis: Songwriters living in ancient Egypt would never have expected the words and melodies they sung would feature on Australian music charts 1,800 years later.

title.children: How voice memos helped bring an 1,800-year-old first hymn back to life

image.altText: Two scientists sit at a desk reading a sheet of paper.

props.synopsis: Almost 100 sensors beside the Federal Highway are helping build the clearest picture yet of the fault beneath the iconic lake.

title.children: Lake George has a hidden earthquake fault zone. Now scientists are using traffic noise to unearth it

image.altText: Close up of ladybugs

props.synopsis: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

title.children: The 'voracious feeders' inside Parliament House

image.altText: GettyImages-2253824052

props.synopsis: Australia's Nick Kyrgios defeated women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the latest 'battle of the sexes'. The Aussie, who has fallen outside the ATP top 600 after barely playing for three years, won 6-3, 6-3.

title.children: 'Happy it's over': Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka in new battle of the sexes

image.altText: Celestial V70 enjoys a Hobart sunrise.

props.synopsis: The yacht race has entered the fourth day, after Master Lock Comanche claimed line honours late on Sunday.

title.children: 'Beat them by a minute': Nervous wait for overall Sydney to Hobart winner

image.altText: A Palestinian carries aid supplies that entered Gaza

props.synopsis: The Israeli government has introduced new rules for aid organisations, including that they must not engage in any activities or criticism which "delegitimise" the state of Israel.

title.children: NGOs fear lifesaving Gaza aid will be blocked under new Israeli rules

image.altText: A graphic showing a vial of the Mounjaro weight loss drug next to three Ozempic pens.

props.synopsis: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

title.children: 'Pesky Aussie laws' comment sparks scrutiny of weight-loss treatment marketing

image.altText: caravans in a row

props.synopsis: Anger is growing after revelations the corporate watchdog failed to investigate allegations against luxury caravan manufacturer Zone RV.

title.children: Caravan customers furious ASIC ignored whistleblower before collapse

image.altText: Climber Sarah Larcombe hanging by her arms off a rock wall. The Australian outback is in the background.

props.synopsis: When Sarah Larcombe fell off Mount Arapiles in February, she thought she just sprained her ankle. What followed was months of ups and downs ending in a stunning world championships result.

title.children: After Sarah Larcombe fell off Arapiles, healing her bones was just the beginning

image.altText: myanmar election

props.synopsis: Myanmar's election has been widely dismissed as a sham by many governments and human rights activists who have said the military will use proxy candidates to legitimise their rule.

title.children: Low voter turnout for first Myanmar elections since military coup

image.altText: hands on steering wheel

props.synopsis: For generations, the courtesy wave has been etched into the Australian culture, but is it on the verge of dying?

title.children: Experiment shows uncertain future for courtesy wave

image.altText: Shane Warne smiles happily.

props.synopsis: Test your knowledge with questions about Shane Warne, Frank Sinatra and Australia's first stamp.

title.children: Quiz: How well do you remember this week in history?

image.altText: A large tower, with several large clocks visible on top of it, seen from ground level.

props.synopsis: It's among the world's most photographed landmarks, a symbol of the United Kingdom and an engineering marvel. And for London's Big Ben the most important night of the year is fast approaching.

title.children: Inside Big Ben, a London icon that's been ringing since 1859

image.altText: Katie Pahlow catches a wave while surfing in Lombok, Indonesia

props.synopsis: When Katie Pahlow turned 60, she decided to finally bite the bullet and book herself in for some surf lessons.

title.children: Why a growing number of older women are living out their surf dream

image.altText: road covered in water

props.synopsis: Intense rainfall across the north and west of Queensland is forecast to cause widespread flooding and damaging winds.

title.children: Towns isolated and livestock at risk as flooding hits Far North Queensland

image.altText: Australia's Travis Head stands on the pitch with his helmet on, raising his bat as he gets to a milestone in a Test.

props.synopsis: Australia star Travis Head says he is not precious about continuing to open the batting beyond this Ashes and will bat wherever the coaches tell him to.

title.children: Travis Head not fazed on opening role in future

image.altText: A car crashed into a house.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old man was taken to hospital after crashing his car into a house in Kurunjang. He failed a breath test at the scene.

title.children: Drink driver crashes car into living room of house in Melbourne's west

image.altText: Maddy Langabeer on the left with another woman next to her, both wearing hats and CWA aprons, smiling with scones.

props.synopsis: More young women are joining the Country Women's Association's city branches, with a passion for jams and scones along with social connection and purpose.

title.children: 'More than just tea and scones': Why young members are joining city's CWA

image.altText: A man in a check shirt leans on a gate

props.synopsis: Police say they responded to reports of a domestic assault at a home in South Australia's south-east on Saturday.

title.children: SA independent MP Nick McBride charged with assault

image.altText: A cricket executive and a head curator stand in front of microphones and recorders, with the curator answering questions.

props.synopsis: MCC boss Stuart Fox staunchly defends chief curator Matt Page after a wild Boxing Day Test finishes within two days.

title.children: MCC boss defends curator Matt Page after two-day Ashes Test

image.altText: White cruise ship on water with island in background.

props.synopsis: The Coral Adventurer has run aground off the coast of Papua New Guinea with more than 120 people aboard, two months after the death of a passenger allegedly left behind on a Great Barrier Reef island.

title.children: Australian cruise ship runs aground off PNG

image.altText: Black and white paper receipts are arranged on a timber table.

props.synopsis: Most shopping receipts in Taiwan are also tickets for a lottery run every second month by the government to increase tax compliance, and there are some big prizes up for grabs.

title.children: Why you might want to keep your receipts when you shop in Taiwan

image.altText: Peter Malley 1

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police say the death in custody of an Indigenous woman in Tennant Creek on Saturday was the result of a "medical episode", while admitting there was no nurse on duty at the time.

title.children: Police say Tennant Creek death in custody was result of 'medical episode'

image.altText: The front of a sandstone building reads' The Donald Trump and The John F. Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Arts'

props.synopsis: Musician Chuck Redd cancelled his Christmas Eve show days after the White House announced the venue would be renamed the Trump Kennedy Center.

title.children: Kennedy Center boss demands $1.5m damages after musician cancels show

image.altText: A candle placed in front of a vigil.

props.synopsis: In the weeks before Christmas, four boys under 16 left home to play a game of soccer. Their forced disappearance at the hands of Ecuador's military has been labelled a national "turning point".

title.children: Four Ecuadorian boys left home to play soccer. They were found beaten, naked and charred

image.altText: George Napper takes a selfie while wearing a black singlet in the car.

props.synopsis: A rising number of Australians are using steroids. But one expert says a lack of knowledge and widespread stigma make it tough to get clinical support.

title.children: Steroid use is 'exploding' in Australia — but quitting is a lonely road

image.altText: The backs of a man and woman who are sitting on a grassy spot overlooking a beach

props.synopsis: Despite wanting to learn how to swim, many from culturally and linguistically diverse communities — particularly adults — face three key barriers to participating.

title.children: Why getting more migrants to swim has benefits for all of Australian society

image.altText: Tasmania Police crime scene tape

props.synopsis: A woman has died and a man has been taken to hospital following a glider crash at a private airfield in Tasmania.

title.children: Woman dies in glider crash, pilot airlifted to Royal Hobart Hospital

image.altText: An image of a man standing on sand, facing the ocean, with his legs blurred.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged for allegedly displaying what police have called "hate symbol" tattoos at a beach in Newcastle.

title.children: Man charged for allegedly displaying hate symbol tattoos at NSW beach

image.altText: a woman with hand on her face is drawn in three overlapping neon colours

props.synopsis: From the rise of misinformation and AI to escalating political tensions, vast economic disparity, and the erosion of social bonds, the vibe shift is now understood as a deep, unsettling change in our collective reality.

title.children: Forget brat summer, the vibe shift is here and it's terrifying
